name: Job the Leprechaun
description: Help Job the Leprechaun to rescue his friend Eri in this retro style Platformer Game.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo Memory: 512 MB RAM DirectX: Version 8.0 Storage: 10 MB available space

reviews.review_text: If you get it from a bundle, and you'd like to have ~ 1-1.5 hours of casual platforming in retro style, go for it. Don't mind this review if you're intrested in gameplay-releated review, as it's okay.  But I'm not willing to rate this game positive. Hit detection is indeedwonky - I've got killed by shots what was going above my hat, while I killed zombie-dogs (?) who was basically *inside* me and still survived.  But my main gripe is game design. Level design is okay, most levels can be easily completed within the time limit - but game design.  -There's no way to exit the game unless you start a game - no escape option in menu, and neither escape button works.  -The game's controls are simple (4 directons+jump+hit) but one can not rebind the buttons. And while X-Y is a common pick for the old A B buttons, my qwertz keyboard begs to differ that this is the best available option. Yes, I know I can change it to english with shift-alt as I've done it, but still - non-rebindable controls should be forbidden in 2015.
Great little platformer. Looks good and sounds good. I just wish it didn't make you start all the way back at the beginning of the game when you run out of continues.
